definition: to summon one's (courage, faith etc)/to puff up (one's cheeks etc)/to bulge/to swell out
drum/CL:通[tong4],面[mian4]/to drum/to strike/to rouse/to bulge/to swell

to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group

sentences.english: I plucked up the courage to ask her out. She agreed.
sentences.chinese: 後來，我終於鼓起勇氣單獨約她出去。

sentences.english: The three of them applauded, Isabel clapping her thigh.
sentences.chinese: 她們三個鼓起掌，伊薩貝爾拍拍她臀部。

sentences.english: Her skirt ballooned in the wind.
sentences.chinese: 她的裙子讓風吹得鼓起來了。

sentences.english: Have courage and ask. Then you know what you have to deal with.
sentences.chinese: 鼓起勇氣去問問他，然後你就知道你改怎麼做了。

sentences.english: I mustered up enough courage to accuse him.
sentences.chinese: 我鼓起足夠的勇氣控告他。

sentences.english: His coat ballooned in the high wind.
sentences.chinese: 他的外套在大風中鼓起。
學生們都開始鼓起掌來。

sentences.english: Mrs Durbeyfield clapped her hands like a child.
sentences.chinese: 德北菲爾德太太像一個孩子似地鼓起掌來。

sentences.english: Joe's eyes bulged and his jaw dropped.
sentences.chinese: 喬的眼睛鼓起，而且他的顎降低。

sentences.english: Berenice strove valiantly to retain a serene interest.
sentences.chinese: 白麗萊茜鼓起勇氣保持一種冷靜的興趣。

sentences.english: He mustered up enough courage to attack the difficulty.
sentences.chinese: 他鼓起足夠的勇氣去攻克難關。

sentences.english: Paiko summoned up some courage and smiled at the Sergeant.
sentences.chinese: Paiko鼓起來一點勇氣，對着警官笑了一下。

sentences.english: She's mustering up courage to face the future.
sentences.chinese: 她重新鼓起勇氣面對未來。

sentences.english: A tyre expanda when you pump air into it.
sentences.chinese: 給輪胎充氣輪胎會鼓起來的。

sentences.english: Last year I summoned up the courage to paint them.
sentences.chinese: 去年我鼓起勇氣把它們全體粉刷了。

definition: to puff up/to swell up/to inflate/to blow air into sth/(fig.) to encourage/to support
to erect (a tent etc)/to prick up (one's ears)/to raise (one's eyebrows)/to stick up (one's thumb)/to turn up (one's collar)/(of a bird) to puff up (one's feathers)
to heave/to lift/to raise up/to uphold
to raise one's head/to perk up
lit. to bite the teeth tightly (idiom); fig. to grit one's teeth and bear the pain/to bite the bullet
